ygData.subject: Re: Advice for a new Necromancer
ygData.msgSnippet: 12 is whre the necros get their first taste of REAL POWER, their pet is a complete bad ass, being able to hit magic creatures and having a ton of HP, plus get
ygData.messageBody:
12 is whre the necros get their first taste of REAL POWER, their pet is a
complete bad ass, being able to hit magic creatures and having a ton of HP,
plus get get a drain spell that does 32 or so damage, i don't know exactly,
plus heat blood which does around 100 DOT Damage Over Time, and heart
flutter which i hear is cool but have never tried it. One of my friends had
a problem from 10-12, it took him 2 weeks for 2 lvls, but after he hit 12 he
got to 16 in 2 weeks, 4 lvls. I would say 10-11 is the hardest for a necro,
because skels don't give ya hardly any xp at lvl 10 and at 11, and nothing
else is easy to kill because they either own your pet, or shrug off your
shitty drain spell that does a WHOPPING 11 or 12 damage, hehe.





>From: "Murphy, Kenneth E." <MurphyK@...>
>
>Hello.
>
>I recently started a new dark elf necromancer on Mythannial Marr. I'm a
>whole lev 2 at this point. I haven't trained any skills yet at the guild
>hall. Can I get some advice as to what spells to focus on? Is 2H staffs the
>weapon I should be using?
>
>Also at what level will I start to get a good feel for being a necromancer
>and start coming into my own? Are there any levels I should just gut out?
>For example my lev 15 magician had a very rough time at lev7 but at lev8
>things were MUCH easier. When I get lev 16 with my magician tomorrow or the
>next day I'll again see a HUGE increase in power. I'm assuming Necromancers
>work the same way?
>
>Any tips would be appreciated.
>
>Eloric Lev2 Necro - Mythannial Marr -
>
>... Thanks Kenneth
>
>Kenneth E. Murphy, OCP
